sentences.en: Additional symbols are required to describe evaporation processes of this type.
sentences.cn: 描述这类蒸发过程,需要补充符号.

sentences.en: At this state condensation and evaporation are at an equilibrium and take place at the same rate.
sentences.cn: 在这种状态时水的凝结和蒸发达到平衡状态并且以相同的速度进行。

sentences.en: Be careful not to lose too much liquid by evaporation.
sentences.cn: 小心不要因蒸发失去太多水分.

sentences.en: Because it is located in a very hot and dry region, the Dead Sea loses much water through evaporation, causing its level to fluctuate during the year.
sentences.cn: 因为它处于一个非常炎热和干燥的地区，死海由于蒸发损失掉大量的水，导致其水平面一年到头不断波动。

sentences.en: From the evaporation of water, people know that liquids can turn into gases under certain conditions.
sentences.cn: 根据水的蒸发现象, 人们认识到液体在一定条件下可以变成气体.

sentences.en: High temperatures also result in high evaporation from the plants.
sentences.cn: 高温也导致了植物水分的大量蒸发。

sentences.en: However, for a while the land around the city acted as a natural air conditioner, keeping the air cool through evaporation of moisture from the ground.
sentences.cn: 不过，有一段时间，莫斯科市周围的土地起到了自然空调的作用，通过从地面蒸发湿气保持空气凉爽。

sentences.en: If evaporation and concentration continues a saturated solution will eventually be produced.
sentences.cn: 如果继续蒸发和浓缩,最终就形成饱和溶液.

sentences.en: Larger drops fall quickly and can better afford to lose mass by evaporation.
sentences.cn: 较大的雨滴下落得很快,蒸发引起的质量损失较少.

sentences.en: Most of atmosphere's water vapor comes from evaporation of sea water.
sentences.cn: 大气中的水汽大部分来自海水蒸发.

sentences.en: Our bodies can sweat, thereby losing heat by evaporation.
sentences.cn: 我们的身体能出汗，由此可以蒸发散热。

sentences.en: Silicon is usually added by co - evaporation.
sentences.cn: 硅通常是通过共蒸发来加入的.

sentences.en: The asphalt mostly through the natural evaporation and oxidation, generally do not contain any poison.
sentences.cn: 这种沥青大都经过天然蒸发、氧化，一般已不含有任何毒素。

sentences.en: The crust seals the soil and prevents the evaporation of water.
sentences.cn: 这层表皮把土壤封闭,防止水份蒸发.

sentences.en: The latex concentration is raised by evaporation or centrifugation.
sentences.cn: 通过挥发或离心作用提高胶乳的浓度.

sentences.en: The moist water of the earth is exhausted by evaporation.
sentences.cn: 土地中的水分全被蒸发光了.

sentences.en: The rain drops will be subject to evaporation in the unsaturated subcloud layer.
sentences.cn: 在非饱和的云下层,雨滴将被蒸发.

sentences.en: The soothing, cooling effect is caused by the evaporation of the sweat on the skin.
sentences.cn: 这种放松而又凉爽的感觉是由于皮肤表面汗液的蒸发而产生的。

sentences.en: There has not been much change in rainfall in those areas but the temperature has risen by over 1 degree Centigrade since 1970, which will have enhanced losses due to evaporation.
sentences.cn: 那些地区的降雨量没有太大变化，但是自1970年以来上升的气温已经超过了1摄氏度，由于蒸发这将会造成水分的更大流失。

sentences.en: There is generally more evaporation over the oceans and more precipitation over the land.
sentences.cn: 通常在海洋蒸发量较大,而陆地上则降水量较大.

sentences.en: Water enters air via evaporation.
sentences.cn: 水通过蒸发进入空气。
